__prompts__.git_base_url:
Remote URL to host your new repositories (git), e.g.
	https://github.com/deephdc (i.e. at github).
	https://git.scc.kit.edu/deep (or somewhere else)
__prompts__.package_slug:
URL-friendly version of the model api name.
This makes it suitable for use in URLs, filenames and other places.
__prompts__.package_name:
Unique identifier for the model api package.
Also defines the repository name, added after "git_base_url" (see above).
	Should be a valid Python name
__prompts__.add_model_template: Create a folder template to start a model from the base.
__prompts__.add_model_from_repo:
Integrate a model from a git repository as git submodule, e.g.
	git@github.com:your_organization/model_name.git
	Ignored if `add_model_template`
__prompts__.add_model_from_pypi:
Add model from PyPI repository as requirement, e.g.
	ultralytics~=8.0
	Ignored if `add_model_template`
__prompts__.author_name:
Author name(s) (and/or your organization/company/team).
	If many, separate by comma
__prompts__.author_email:
E-Mail(s) of main author(s).
	If many, separate by comma
__prompts__.description: A short description of the project.
__prompts__.open_source_license:
Select one of the licenses, default is MIT.
	For more info: https://opensource.org/licenses.
__prompts__.dockerhub_user:
User account at hub.docker.com, e.g.
	'deephdc' in https://hub.docker.com/u/deephdc.
__prompts__.docker_baseimage:
Docker image your Dockerfile starts from (FROM <docker_baseimage>).
	Do not provide the tag, yet
__prompts__.baseimage_cpu_tag:
CPU tag for the baseimage, e.g. 2.9.1.
	Should match and use python3
__prompts__.baseimage_gpu_tag:
GPU tag for the baseimage, e.g. 2.9.1-gpu.
	Should match and use python3
__prompts__.failure_notify: Receive an email if module build fails.
